content.prompt: Two closed, cylindrical containers with fixed volumes have the same diameter, and each container holds a sample of ideal gas with the same number of molecules. The containers are brought into thermal contact, as shown, and then isolated from the surrounding environment. Container X has twice the volume of Container Y. Container Y is initially at a higher temperature than Container X. Which of the following best describes the change in temperature of the gas in Container Y immediately after the two containers are brought into thermal contact, and gives a reason for that change?

choices.label: The temperature of the gas in Container Y will increase because thermal energy is transferred out of the larger container and into the smaller container Y.
The temperature of the gas in Container Y will increase because the faster-moving atoms will make more collisions with the container walls than the atom in Container X.
The temperature of the gas in Container Y will decrease because the pressure is higher in Container Y, and energy will be transferred until the pressures are the same.
The temperature of the gas in Container Y will decrease because energy is transferred from the gas at higher temperature to the gas at lower temperature.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
